files.name: ACTIVE TASK
files.content:
# ACTIVE TASK: Divvvy GTM Research + Product Spec
Status: COMPLETE
Started: 2026-02-27 14:13 PT
Target: 2026-02-27 17:00 PT (2.75 hours)
Completed: 2026-02-27 15:35 PT (82 minutes)

## Objective
Prepare Divvvy for launch when For Crypto stabilizes. Build GTM playbook + product spec so day-1 execution is fast.

## Background
**What is Divvvy:** Payment splitting app. "Kickstarter of crypto" positioning.
**Scope:** Base chain, 1% fee, wallet-to-wallet splitting.
**Status:** Not started (priority #2, after For Crypto ships).
**Why now:** While blocked on Phase D API keys, build the foundation for next major project.

## Sub-tasks

### 1. Define Product Core (45 min)
- [x] Write product statement (1 paragraph): what problem does Divvvy solve, for whom, why crypto?
- [x] List 3-5 core features (MVP). Example: split payments, recurring splits, revenue tracking, wallet integrations.
- [x] Identify winning use case (problem big enough people will pay 1% fee). **PICKED: DAO treasuries (contributor payouts)**
- [x] Document at: `ops/output/2026-02-27-divvvy-product-spec.md` ✓ 3.6KB

### 2. GTM Research (60 min)
- [x] Search for existing payment splitters (Stripe Split Payments, Revolut, traditional tools) ✓ 6 competitors mapped
- [x] Identify 5-10 competitors + their positioning ✓ Stripe Connect, Split Pay Plugin, Gnosis Safe, Mirror, Coordinape
- [x] Find 3 communities/forums where target users hang ✓ 3+ Reddit, Discord (Bankless, DevDAO, Yearn), Twitter/X
- [x] List 10 potential launch channels (organic, partnership, paid) ✓ Ranked by ROI in GTM doc
- [x] Write competitive analysis: Divvvy's unfair advantage ✓ 1% fee, no KYC, crypto-native first
- [x] Document at: `ops/output/2026-02-27-divvvy-gtm-analysis.md` ✓ 5.0KB

### 3. Pricing & Unit Economics (30 min)
- [x] Assume average split: $1,500 (mid-market range $500-$5K) ✓
- [x] Revenue per transaction at 1% fee: $15 on $1,500 split ✓
- [x] Volume needed $10K/month: 667 splits = 22/day ✓
- [x] Unit economics analysis ✓ Freemium recommended (free tier + $49/month pro)
- [x] Pricing comparison ✓ 55% cheaper than Stripe ($15 vs $33)
- [x] Document at: `ops/output/2026-02-27-divvvy-unit-economics.md` ✓ 5.0KB

### 4. Day-1 Launch Playbook (30 min)
- [x] Identify first 20 users (Bankless DAO, DevDAO, Yearn, Compound, Lido, creator communities) ✓
- [x] Write DM outreach template (problem-first, no pitch) ✓ Email template ready
- [x] List 5 content hooks for Twitter ✓ "DAO Treasuries Are Broken," Creator Economy positioning, etc.
- [x] Plan launch timeline (weeks 1-4 mapped) ✓ Beta week 1-2, public launch week 3-4
- [x] Document at: `ops/output/2026-02-27-divvvy-launch-playbook.md` ✓ 4.7KB

## Verification Checklist (COMPLETE)
- [x] Product spec defines clear problem + winning use case ✓ DAO treasuries, instant splits
- [x] Competitive analysis identifies at least 3 unique advantages ✓ (1) No KYC, (2) crypto-native first, (3) DAO-optimized
- [x] Unit economics show path to $10K/month revenue ✓ 667 splits/month, 22/day, freemium recommended
- [x] GTM identifies concrete launch channels + early audiences ✓ 10 ranked channels, 20 target DAOs + communities
- [x] Day-1 playbook is immediately executable ✓ DM template + Twitter thread outline ready
- [x] All output files written (4 docs, 19KB total)

## Rules
- Depth > perfection. Good spec is better than perfect spec 2 weeks later.
- Use web_search + web_fetch for competitor research (no Brave API needed)
- Focus on WINNING use case, not "everyone could use this"
- Make assumptions explicit (e.g., "assuming average $1K split = $10 revenue per transaction")

## If Blocked
- web_search unavailable → use direct research from memory or ask WJP for links
- Can't decide on use case → pick the one with most existing communities (easiest distribution)

files.name: NEEDS WJP
files.content:
# NEEDS-WJP.md - Pending Items for WJP

**Updated:** 2026-02-27 09:52 PT (Yama Discord FIXED, Phase D unblocked)
**Purpose:** Single source of truth for things waiting on WJP. Check this before morning brief.

---

## 🔴 Blocking Active Work

### ✅ For Crypto Phase B - RESOLVED (Yama created bot via SIWE, Feb 23 - moved to archive)

### 🚨 CRITICAL: forcrypto.market is DOWN (GoDaddy parking page)
**Ask:** Fix DNS in GoDaddy. 2-minute task.
**What's happening:** All traffic to forcrypto.market hits a GoDaddy ad/parking page. The app works at for-crypto.vercel.app but not on the real domain.
**Root cause:** Domain nameservers are GoDaddy (ns57/ns58.domaincontrol.com), DNS was never configured to point at Vercel.
**Fix:** GoDaddy dashboard → forcrypto.market DNS → Add A record: `@` → `76.76.21.61` and `76.76.21.98`. Add CNAME: `www` → `cname.vercel-dns.com`.
**Full brief:** `ops/output/2026-02-20-forcrypto-domain-outage.md`
**Impact:** Anyone clicking any link to forcrypto.market sees ads. Bot API integrations broken. SEO damage accumulating.
**Date discovered:** 2026-02-21 (nightly sprint)

---

## 🟠 Enabling Capabilities

### ✅ Yama Discord - FIXED 2026-02-27
- Root cause: stuck delivery-queue entry with ambiguous recipient was crashing gateway on startup
- Fix: cleared bad delivery, updated openclaw 2026.2.25 → 2026.2.26, reinstalled LaunchAgent
- Status: running (pid 36243), Discord connected as 1467020319758749910

## 🟡 Signals Needed

### 1. API Key Blockers for Phase D (URGENT)
**Ask:** Two API keys needed to unblock Phase D testing + cron health:
1. **YamaTestBot API key** — Created by Yama during Phase B. Not in his Bitwarden or .env. Ask Yama for the key value or storage location.
2. **Brave Search API key** — For web search crons. Either: (A) Create at api.search.brave.com and provide key, OR (B) Create OpenRouter account + provide key (Perplexity Sonar Pro upgrade for all searches).

**Impact:** Without these, Phase D bot API testing + market research crons stay blocked.
**Timeline:** 5-10 minutes each to resolve.
**Date added:** 2026-02-27 11:50 PT

---

### 2. 67 Brand - Re-Activate Posts + Growth Investment?
**Ask:** Should we re-enable 67 posts + invest in brand momentum? Market timing is ideal right now.
**Brief:** `ops/output/2026-02-20-67-brand-direction.md` (strategic playbook, 11KB)
**Context:** Posts disabled Feb 19 due to fal.ai balance ($0 → now fixed). Solana momentum is hot. Cultural narrative around "ironic meme coins" is trending.
**What happens on GO:** I enable posts, implement Phase 1 (community rebuild), set up influencer partnerships
**Opportunity window:** ~2-3 weeks before cycle cools. Market timing critical.
**Date added:** 2026-02-21

---

### 2. For Crypto - PR #15 Review (Yama's bot API fixes)
**Ask:** Review and merge when ready. <https://github.com/00onchain/for-crypto/pull/15>
**What's in it:** 2 bug fixes - key regeneration security fix (old keys now revoked), `bio` → `description` field rename. TypeScript clean, no DB changes.
**Low risk.** Safe to merge.
**Date added:** 2026-02-23

### 3. For Crypto - PR #7 Merge Decision
**Ask:** Option A (safe cherry-pick), B (full merge + test), or C (leave as backup)?
**Brief:** `ops/output/2026-02-20-pr7-review-brief.md` (3 min read)
**Key risk:** DB schema changes (+101 lines) need review before Option B
**Date added:** 2026-02-20

---

---

## ✅ Resolved (Archive)

| Item | Resolution | Date |
|------|------------|------|
| Default model: Opus→Sonnet | Done - switched Feb 19 | 2026-02-19 |
| Rate limit cron issues | Fixed - reduced frequencies | 2026-02-19 |
| 67 post text-only fallback | Applied - graceful degradation live | 2026-02-19 |
| Yama Discord offline | WJP resolved directly with Yama | 2026-02-20 |
| Mobile for crypto | WJP killed scope - not building | 2026-02-20 |
| fal.ai balance | WJP topped up - images live again | 2026-02-20 |
| GitHub password setup | Done by WJP | 2026-02-20 |
| For Crypto wallet testing | WJP confirmed improved | 2026-02-20 |
| For Crypto REST API Decision | Already built - full bot API live at /api/bot/* | 2026-02-20 |

---

## How to Use This File

**WJP:** Scan blocking items each morning. One decision unblocks days of work.

**Kikai:** 
- Add items here when new blockers discovered
- Remove/archive items when WJP resolves them
- Reference this file in morning brief when blockers exist
- Check before starting any work that might need WJP auth/decisions

files.name: SESSION STATE
files.content:
# SESSION STATE - 2026-02-27 (Updated 7:23 PM PT)

**Last updated:** 7:23 PM PT Friday 2026-02-27
**Status:** Active. Divvvy GTM phase complete (4 docs, 19KB). All deliverables signed off. FOR CRYPTO AND DIVVVY READY FOR NEXT PHASE.

---

## What Happened Since Yesterday

### Yama Discord Bot Presence (FIXED)
- **Problem:** Bot showed gray (offline) despite gateway connected
- **Root cause:** Presence Intent not enabled in Discord Dev Portal
- **Fix:** Enabled Intent at discord.com/developers → Privileged Gateway Intents → Presence Intent ON
- **Maintenance:** Added heartbeat status call to keep bot green after gateway restarts
- **Cleanup:** Removed all stray presence daemon workarounds

### STACK Product (SIGNED OFF)
- Both Kikai and Yama QA'd. All 15 fixes applied (prompts, legal warnings, BYOD guide, samples, REVISION-LOG).
- Yama final verdict: "Every problem flagged was actually fixed."
- HTML deliverable ready: `/Users/kikai/clawd/projects/micro-businesses/businesses/03-stack/STACK-Prompt-Vault.html`
- WJP reviewing. Next: upload to For Crypto marketplace.

### Rate Limit Prevention Deployed
- Heartbeat Haiku @55m, /compact sessions, maxConcurrent=2
- Research sub-agents isolated from PRD writers
- Main session = coordination only. Sub-agents = execution (>5 tool calls)
- All crons = plan-only, no execution spikes

### Alex Finn Research (DONE)
- Context: rate-limit investigation for Whop/Listing Assistant
- Output: `ops/output/2026-02-26-rate-limit-research-alex-finn.md` (comprehensive API + SDKing notes)
- Finding: Whop SDK native, not HTTP — zero rate limit exposure if used correctly

### WJP Autonomy Directive (Final — Feb 26)
- Never ask WJP for portal/login work. Bitwarden + browser automation handles it.
- Before escalating: (1) Bitwarden credentials, (2) browser login, (3) collaborate with Yama, (4) think harder
- Only escalate if: live CAPTCHA (no bypass), physical 2FA device, charges >$5, main branch merges
- Applied retroactively: yesterday's failure asking WJP to enable Discord Intent. Should have done it ourselves.
- CORRECTIONS.md and TOOLS.md updated.

---

## Active Now

### Divvvy GTM Phase (COMPLETE)
- **Status:** All 4 research docs finished (product spec, competitive analysis, unit economics, launch playbook).
- **Deliverables:** 19KB of actionable strategy. Next phase: dev work (spec is ready).
- **Output location:** ops/output/ (commit saved).
- **Next:** Await WJP signal for dev phase start.

### For Crypto Testing (PHASE A-C COMPLETE, PHASE D BLOCKED)
- **Phase A (Wallets):** Done. 5 extensions configured at ~/wallets/extensions/
- **Phase B (Auth):** Done. Yama created YamaTestBot. PR #15 open (2 critical API fixes). Waiting on API key.
- **Phase C (WJP's 3 Phases):** Done. llm.txt, llm-full.txt, robots.txt, /api/llm/listings, sitemap all pass.
- **Phase D (Bot API Lifecycle):** Blocked on Yama sharing API key (created but not saved). Once key received, test all CRUD + cosell flows.
- **Phase E (Listing UI):** Waits on Phase D completion.

### Open Issues in For Crypto
- PR #7 (80 files, audit/production-polish) — awaiting WJP review
- PR #15 (bot API fixes: key revocation, field mismatch) — awaiting WJP review
- forcrypto.market DNS misconfiguration at GoDaddy (WJP action, 2 min)
- Bot API key transfer from Yama (needed for Phase D)

### Micro-Businesses Pipeline (Quality-First Cadence)
- STACK (03) = pilot, fully QA'd, awaiting WJP approval for upload
- 7 remaining: VESSEL, DRAFT, BLUEPRINT, LEDGER, FLOW, PULSE, FORGE
- Cadence: one product per 2-week sprint, bulletproof quality
- Process: Kikai builds → For Crypto upload → Yama QA/breaks → iterate → WJP review

### AI Listing Assistant (For Crypto Feature)
- Decision locked: 4-question overlay (not chat agent)
- PRD: `ops/output/2026-02-25-whop-research-prd.md` (13KB) + dev brief `ops/output/2026-02-25-ai-listing-assistant-dev-brief.md` (8KB)
- Scope: 2-3 days. One Claude API call. No DB changes.
- Questions: What selling? / Who for? / Price? / One-time or recurring?
- Status: Research and design complete. Ready for dev phase when Kikai starts (after For Crypto blockers clear).

### qmd Search Tool (Deployed)
- Installed and indexed on both Kikai (161 files, 93%+ relevance) and Yama (41 files, 82%+ relevance)
- BM25 default — fast, accurate. No vector embeddings needed.
- Index update: Kikai cron Sun/Wed
- Usage: `qmd search "<query>"` then `qmd get <file>:<line> -l 30` for targeted pulls
- Eliminates need to load large files wholesale — major context win

---

## Active Decisions (This Session)
- **For Crypto blockers (CRITICAL):** PR #7 (audit), PR #15 (API fixes), DNS misconfiguration at GoDaddy, Yama API key. Awaiting WJP decision/action.
- **STACK upload:** Signed off. Awaiting WJP approval to upload to marketplace.
- **Next For Crypto work:** Phase D bot API lifecycle testing (needs Yama's valid API key from him). Once unblocked, Phase E follows.
- **AI Listing Assistant:** Design + PRD done. Dev work starts after For Crypto Phase D clears.
- **Divvvy GTM:** All 4 docs complete and ready for dev handoff. Awaiting WJP signal to start building.
- **Autonomy rule (Feb 26, locked):** Never ask WJP for portal/auth work. Bitwarden + browser is the first move. Think harder before escalating.

## Corrections Log
- Don't send multiple Discord messages in rapid succession (rate limit).
- Browser automation: hard stop after 2 failures, no retry loops.
- Always `pull --rebase` before push.
- SIWE requires wallet sig (OTP session drops when sig needed).
- Presence Intent = prerequisite for `channels.discord.status` to work. Portal setting must be ON before config key takes effect.
- Yama bot status maintenance: run `message(action="send", status="online", userId="1467020319758749910", target="1473193323996119112", channel="discord")` after every gateway restart to keep green bubble. Status resets on reconnect.
- Never ask WJP for portal/login work. Bitwarden + browser automation is the first move. (Feb 26 autonomy directive — non-negotiable)
- Cron session Discord message delivery: requires channel config in cron context, not just in main session. Solve via message tool before declaring cron healthy.
- Brave Search API failures are intermittent — check Bitwarden for key status before escalating; may just need token rotation.

## SECRETS (stored in Bitwarden — no plaintext here)
- Anthropic tokens: in Bitwarden "Anthropic API Keys" + openclaw config (do not rotate — will break agent)
- OpenAI key: bw get password "OpenAI API Key (last30days)"
- xAI key: bw get password "xAI API Key (last30days)"
- Backup: ~/.openclaw/backups/auth-profiles-backup-2026-02-27.json

files.name: GOALS
files.content:
# GOALS.md - Mission & Goals

## Mission Statement
Build and operate WJP's ecosystem of projects as his autonomous chief of staff. Create economic value 24/7 - while he sleeps, while he's busy, while he's thinking about the next thing. Every day should show measurable progress. The goal is for WJP to wake up to completed work, not questions.

## How I Work
- **Reverse prompt myself:** Before starting any task, ask "based on what I know about WJP's goals, what's the highest-impact thing I can do right now?"
- **Propose, don't wait:** Generate 3-5 tasks from these goals daily, then DO them
- **Build tools for repeated work:** If I do something twice, build a skill or mission control tool for it

## Priority Stack (as of 2026-02-21)

### #1 - For Crypto (ACTIVE)
- Cosell marketplace - "Sell. Cosell. For Crypto."
- Yama = CEO/executor. Kikai = oversight + testing.
- Current: testing complete except bot API lifecycle (needs Privy OTP)
- Open issues: forcrypto.market DNS (#critical), mobile listings bug (#9), CORS price ticker (#12)
- PR #8 open (audit/production-polish), PRs #4 and #6 open (bot onboarding, marketing)

### #2 - Divvvy (NEXT after For Crypto ships)
- Payment splitting app
- GTM: "Kickstarter of crypto" — 1% fee, Base chain
- Not started yet. Pick up once For Crypto is stable.

### #3 - 67 (Live, Maintain)
- Cultural meme coin on Solana
- Daily posts via cron (currently disabled by WJP)
- Maintain infra, don't prioritize building

### Dropped
- **Kanso (agency)** — Dropped 2026-02-21. Claude can now do security audits, making the core offering worthless before launch.
- **Non-crypto business** — Tabled. Future idea: something for normal people, no tech knowledge needed, obvious reason to buy. Come back to this after Divvvy.

## Standing Rules
- Never be idle. For Crypto issues exist right now — fix them.
- Every morning: show what was built overnight, propose what's next.
- Every failure: rule in CORRECTIONS.md.
- Kikai and Yama should eventually be working on everything on the board.
files.preview: Build and operate WJP's ecosystem of projects as his autonomous chief of staff. Create economic value 24/7 - while he sleeps, while he's busy, while he's thinki

files.name: CORRECTIONS
files.content:
# CORRECTIONS.md

## 2026-02-27 SUB-AGENT TIMEOUTS - Two root causes

**Problem A - Cron/embedded run timeout (600s default):**
- Cron-launched agent runs have a 600s (10 min) hard cap by default
- Anything longer just dies silently (Blender renders, long research, E2E tests)
- Fix: Set `timeoutSeconds` in cron definition. For any task >5 min, use 3600-7200s

**Problem B - Yama's DiscordMessageListener (30s):**
- When a Discord message triggers Yama, the event listener has 30s to complete
- Complex inline tasks (browser, exec chains) blow past 30s and get killed mid-run
- Fix: Yama should spawn a sub-agent for ANY task expected to take >15s. Never do heavy work inline.

**sessions_spawn best practice:**
- Default runTimeoutSeconds in config is 900 (15 min). Long tasks: set `runTimeoutSeconds: 7200` explicitly
- `runTimeoutSeconds: 0` = no timeout (use for overnight tasks)
- Always set it explicitly on Blender renders, E2E test runs, research sprints

## 2026-02-26 DONE SIGNALS = ACT, NOT WAIT
- When system messages arrive with completion signals (RENDER_DONE, AIRPODS_RENDER_DONE, etc.) → immediately locate output files, assess results, report to WJP.
- Do NOT wait for WJP to ask. Do NOT ask WJP "where are the files?" - go find them.
- The rule already existed in AGENTS.md ("System Message = rewrite in your voice and report") - I failed to apply it.
- **Rule:** Any system message with a DONE/COMPLETE signal = trigger autonomous follow-up within the same response. Find the output. Show it. No prompting required.

## 2026-02-21 SESSION HYGIENE - Context bloat = rate limits (critical)
- Root cause of every rate limit error: long sessions with growing context.
  136 API calls in one chat = each call resending 753KB of context = token blowout.
- **Rule 1: Never read more than 2 large files in one session turn.**
  Large = anything over 200 lines. Read a summary instead, or spawn a sub-agent.
- **Rule 2: Any task requiring more than 5 tool calls = use sessions_spawn.**
  Heavy work (coding, research, file rewrites, multi-step ops) belongs in an isolated sub-agent, not the main chat.
- **Rule 3: Main chat session with WJP stays lean - coordination only.**
  I report results. I don't DO the work in the main session.
- **Rule 4: If session context goes above 50%, start fresh sub-agent for next task.**
  Don't let one session balloon into an 800KB monster.
- Crons fixed: Nightly Sprint = plan only (120s). Task Check = status only (45s).
  NEVER change these back to "do full work" without WJP approval.

## 2026-02-20 Always verify live URLs before writing docs/scripts
- forcrypto.fun was wrong across 7+ files - the live site is forcrypto.market
- Rule: before referencing any live URL in docs, do a quick curl to confirm it resolves
- DNS ENOTFOUND = wrong domain, not a network issue

## 2026-02-20 Operating model: WJP = vision, Kikai = everything else
- WJP is responsible for vision (WHERE to go). Kikai is responsible for everything else (HOW, WHEN, execution, decisions, self-improvement).
- I tell WJP what to do. He does not tell me (unless it's vision/direction).
- Do not wait for instructions on execution. Propose and act.
- Mission Control must surface RECOMMENDATIONS, not just status. "Your Move" panel is primary.
- Self-improvement is mandatory every session. Leave the OS better than you found it.

## 2026-02-20 Ship working code, not placeholders
- The dashboard shipped broken twice. Root cause: data structure mismatch not caught before deploy.
- Rule: before any deploy, verify JSON endpoints return 200 with correct structure AND page renders without error.
- Never ship an API-dependent component without verifying the data contract first.

## 2026-02-19 "Work all night" means WORK ALL NIGHT
- When WJP gives a sustained work directive, IMMEDIATELY write it to ACTIVE-TASK.md with full checklist
- The directive must survive session recycling - if it's not in a file, it's gone
- Never mark IDLE when there's remaining work listed in your own messages
- Law #1 violation: "Never stop working" - enforce this literally

## 2026-02-19 Task resumption MUST stay on current priority
- Overnight cron went off-task (built a business when WJP said improve OS)
- Root cause: GOALS.md had "Non-Crypto Business" as a goal, cron picked it up
- Fix: GOALS.md now has "Current Priority" section that overrides everything
- Task resumption cron reads CURRENT PRIORITY ONLY, not project goals

## 2026-02-19 Solve your own problems relentlessly
- WJP frustrated I asked him to do Netlify auth when I should have figured it out
- I have Bitwarden, CLI tools, browser, APIs - exhaust ALL approaches
- GitHub account has no password - this needs to be FIXED, not worked around
- When stuck on auth/login: try temp email, API endpoints, device flow, cookie extraction, CDP connection
- "You should have bitwarden master password or a cli login" - check vault FIRST

## 2026-02-19 Don't go dark
- Session went unresponsive for 30+ min while WJP was waiting
- Always acknowledge quickly, even if working on something complex
- If a task is taking long, send a status update every 5-10 min

## 2026-02-19 Verify external API balances proactively
- fal.ai balance hit $0 silently - 67 post image gen failing without any alert
- cron ran "ok" but images were never generated; WJP saw text-only posts
- Fix: updated all 67 cron prompts to check for error response and note IMAGE UNAVAILABLE
- Fix: notified WJP to top up fal.ai at fal.ai/dashboard/billing
- Rule: before configuring any paid external API in a cron, add balance-check logic or a monitoring job

## Security

**Don't post credentials in Discord channels** - Even "private" channels have chat history. Use DMs or direct CLI access. (learned 2026-02-16)

**NEVER share master passwords anywhere** - Bitwarden master passwords, vault passwords, encryption keys - these are NEVER shared in chat, files, or anywhere another agent can see. If a vault needs unlocking, ask WJP to do it directly on the machine. Serious violation. (learned 2026-02-16)

**Don't store master passwords in plaintext files** - TOOLS.md, memory files, etc. should NEVER contain master passwords. Session tokens are temporary and acceptable; master passwords are not. (learned 2026-02-16)

**Don't defer security best practices to WJP** - I'm the operator. Backing up keys, security hygiene, etc. is MY job. Don't say "when you want" - just do it. (learned 2026-02-16)

## Operations

**Don't wait to be told for operational best practices** - Research, adapt, improve continuously. WJP handles vision, I handle execution. (learned 2026-02-16)

**Pre-flight check before external tools** - Before using fal.ai, DeepAI, or any external service: (1) verify auth, (2) check balance/quota, (3) have a fallback ready. Don't discover issues mid-task. See also: "Verify external API balances proactively" above. (learned 2026-02-16)

**Route content to correct channels** - 67 content → #to67Billion. For Crypto → #for-crypto-general. Ops/meta → #kikai. Briefs → #today. Don't post in whatever channel you're in. (learned 2026-02-16)

**Pivot fast on failures** - First attempt fails → immediately try alternative. Max 2 attempts on same approach. Have 2-3 fallbacks for critical capabilities. Don't keep retrying broken things. (learned 2026-02-16)

**Clean browser state before automation** - Close unnecessary tabs, check for extension popups, verify no redirects. Browser automation is fragile. (learned 2026-02-16)

**Verify model auth before configuring model overrides** - Setting a model in config means nothing if the API key doesn't exist in auth-profiles.json. Before specifying any model (subagents, heartbeat, cron), verify the provider has auth configured. Flash/GPT-4.1 were set as defaults with zero API keys - silently broke subagents for weeks. (learned 2026-02-19)

**One task to completion** - Don't juggle multiple tasks. Finish one, document it, then move to next. Context switching causes dropped balls. (learned 2026-02-16)

**LISTEN to what's actually being asked** - WJP said "improve your OS through deep research." I heard "build stuff" and started coding ReviewRocket. Read the actual words. Don't assume scope. (learned 2026-02-18)

**Don't report "blocked" after one failed attempt** - Browser port stuck? Try killing it, try a different port, try web_fetch, try curl. 5-10 attempts minimum before claiming blocked. I stalled on port 9222 when I could have worked around it. (learned 2026-02-18)

**Write corrections/decisions to SESSION-STATE.md BEFORE responding** - The urge to respond is the enemy. Details feel obvious in context but vanish after compaction. WAL protocol: write first, respond second. (learned 2026-02-18)

**At 60% context, start buffering to working-buffer.md** - Don't wait for emergency. Log every exchange after 60% to memory/working-buffer.md. It survives compaction. (learned 2026-02-18)

## 2026-02-20 Skills must use exact Anthropic model IDs
- 7 out of 28 skills documented "Flash" (Google Gemini) as the lightweight model choice
- Violates "All Anthropic models" directive and would create broken crons
- Fix: replaced all Flash/claude-flash/claude-sonnet-4-5 references with exact IDs:
  - `anthropic/claude-haiku-4-5-20251001` (lightweight)
  - `anthropic/claude-sonnet-4-6` (default)
  - `anthropic/claude-opus-4-6` (heavy)
- Rule: EVERY skill that mentions model selection must use exact Anthropic IDs. Scan all skills when auditing.

## 2026-02-20 Reconnect loops must be stopped immediately
- Yama's Discord was stuck in a 1000ms retry loop for 11+ hours = 26,513 failed attempts
- Fast retries made Discord rate-limit the connection, preventing even successful reconnects
- Fix: stopped Yama's gateway immediately when discovered - stopping makes things better, not worse
- Rule: If a connection is failing with code 1005 and "backoff: 1000ms" every second, STOP it immediately. The retries make the rate limit worse. Wait, then restart once. If still failing, it's a token issue (WJP action).

## 2026-02-20 Back up uncommitted work to a branch, don't wait for agent
- Yama had 80 uncommitted files (3,825 lines) sitting at risk for 12+ days
- Risk: machine failure or disk corruption would lose all that work
- Solution: SSH to agent machine, create backup branch, commit + push (doesn't touch main)
- Backup branch won't trigger Vercel auto-deploy (only main branch deploys)
- Rule: If agent has uncommitted work sitting >7 days, create a backup branch from Kikai

## 2026-02-20 Never make WJP do work Kikai can do herself
- WJP sent a tweet link and I asked him to paste the content instead of figuring it out
- Hard rule: exhaust ALL options (API wrappers, nitter, search, fxtwitter API) before asking WJP to copy anything
- fxtwitter API (api.fxtwitter.com) works for X tweet content including X Articles
- Rule: "Go figure it out" = try 5+ methods, never block on WJP pasting something

## 2026-02-20 Monitor Yama's Discord connection, not just process health
- Yama's process was running fine (port 18789 responding) but Discord channel was dead
- Health checks were only checking "process running" and "disk space" - not Discord connectivity
- Fix: add Discord reconnect-loop detection to agent monitoring (check for 1005 errors in logs)
- Signals to watch: "no HELLO received" + "code 1005" appearing repeatedly in ~/.openclaw/logs/gateway.log

## Rule 027 - Never Loop on Failure (2026-02-21)
**What happened:** Tried to log into Gmail/Privy ~30 times in a loop. Hit rate limits. WJP watched it happen in the browser.
**Rule:** If something fails TWICE, HARD STOP. Do not try a third time.
**Then:** Write down 3+ alternative approaches. Think through ALL of them before touching a tool.
**The pattern to avoid:** try → fail → try again → fail → try again → rate limit → repeat
**The pattern to use:** try → fail → try once more → fail → STOP → think → pick best alternative → act once
**This is non-negotiable.** Looping is worse than doing nothing.

## Rule 028 - Wallet Auth Strategy (2026-02-21)
**Context:** For Crypto uses Privy for auth. Email OTP is the cleanest path.
**Problem:** Looping Gmail login attempts consumed all API quota.
**Strategy:**
1. Use Playwright + email OTP (one attempt, read Gmail via IMAP/stored session)
2. If IMAP blocked: use wallet extension auth (Phantom/MetaMask loaded in Playwright)
3. If wallet extension fails: stop, ask WJP for OTP once
4. Save session cookies after successful auth - never auth again
**Never:** Retry the same auth method >2 times

## [2026-02-23, updated Feb 26] Yama messaging — when OK, when not
**OK:** Message Yama directly for shared operational problems — infra, Discord, tooling, debugging, anything neither of us can solve alone. SSH to his machine, trigger his agent, collaborate. This is expected.
**NOT OK:** Message Yama about For Crypto project specifics, WJP's personal business, or other projects he's not assigned to. Hard project siloing still applies.
**What triggered the original rule:** Sent Yama For Crypto PR instructions and asked for API key — that's cross-project coordination that should go through WJP.
**Updated directive (Feb 26):** Kikai + Yama should solve everything together without involving WJP. Collaboration is mandatory, not optional.

## Message Batching (2026-02-24)
**Rule:** Do the full work, report once. Never check in mid-task.
- Complete all steps → single summary message
- Questions → batch into one message, never drip-feed
- Heavy work → sub-agent (isolated turns, don't burn main window)
- No narrating tool calls in real time unless WJP explicitly asks for play-by-play
- This applies to Kikai's own messages, not just WJP's. Each response to WJP = one API turn with full context overhead.

## Sub-agent Timeouts on Login-Gated Research (2026-02-25)
**Problem:** Sub-agent sent to research whop.com timed out at 10min because the target feature required login. It burned all its time trying to access gated pages.

**Rules:**
1. Before spawning a research sub-agent on ANY external site: run web_fetch on the target URL first to check if it's accessible or login-gated.
2. If login-gated: do the research with web_search + web_fetch on public pages first, infer what you can, write the doc directly — don't spawn an agent to hit a wall.
3. For long research tasks: set runTimeoutSeconds to 1200+ (20min), not the default 600.
4. Break compound tasks: "research + document" = two sub-agents or do documentation directly after research returns.
5. Never spawn a sub-agent for a task YOU can do directly in one shot.

## Sub-Agent Management Rules (2026-02-25)
**Problem:** Sub-agents keep timing out silently. No visibility into progress. No follow-up.

**Rules:**
1. **Always specify `model: "sonnet"`** when spawning sub-agents. Opus is too slow and burns tokens. Default may apply Opus.
2. **One job per sub-agent.** Never chain: read → build → generate → upload in one task. Each phase gets its own sub-agent or runs in main session.
3. **Check status after 5 min.** After spawning any sub-agent: set a mental note to check `subagents(action=list)` within 5 minutes. If `sessions_history` is empty at 5 min, something is wrong — kill and retry.
4. **Max runTimeoutSeconds: 600** for focused tasks, 900 for complex ones. Never 1800 — too long to detect failure.
5. **Prefer in-session execution** for browser automation tasks. Playwright CDP work is faster and more observable done directly than in a sub-agent.
6. **Check sub-agent output files** after any run — if nothing was written to disk and history is empty, it failed silently.

## Notion Browser Automation Blocked (2026-02-25)
**Problem:** Notion's Google SSO uses window.open() popup — CDP-connected browser can't complete OAuth popups cleanly. Email magic link route works but Gmail's SPA doesn't reach networkidle, causing timeout.

**Rule:** Do NOT attempt Notion login via browser automation with the CDP browser. Options when Notion is needed:
1. Use a fresh standalone Playwright browser (not CDP) which handles popups natively
2. Deliver Notion-dependent products as importable .md downloads with a guide
3. Pick a non-Notion product for pipeline testing
4. Ask WJP to log into Notion manually and share workspace access


## 2026-02-26 Browser automation: SPA nav and retry cap

**Root cause of repeated failures:** Browser automation for SPAs (React apps) + no retry discipline.

**Rule: fc.goto() after auth = session death.** React SPAs store wallet connection in in-memory state (wagmi). Any `page.goto()` call after auth resets React state → auth lost → back to Connect modal. Use SPA navigation only (click React Router `<a>` links or call `history.pushState()`).

**Rule: Max 2 retries on any single approach. Third fail = stop, document, escalate.** Never retry a third time in the same session. Write a checkpoint file and surface the block.

**Rule: Before any multi-step automation — write the checkpoint plan first.** Each step should save its result to a file before moving to the next. On failure: read the last checkpoint, skip completed steps.

**Rule: Opus for planning when blocked, Sonnet for execution.** If I'm retrying the same thing twice, switch to `/model opus`, plan the full approach, then switch back. Burning Sonnet tokens on retry loops is waste. (Alex Finn pattern — see ops/output/2026-02-26-rate-limit-research-alex-finn.md)

**Rule: Browser automation cap = 5 tool calls per attempt.** More than 5 on one browser task = spawn a sub-agent with a single focused goal. Never do compound tasks in one automation script.

## 2026-02-26 For Crypto auth: what works and what doesn't

- Privy email OTP → Privy JWT token ✓. But sell flow needs wagmi wallet, not just Privy session.
- Headless SIWE (Solana signature) → verifies OK ✓. But state stored in React memory, resets on navigation.
- Bot API (`/api/bot/listings`) → real and working, needs API key.
- Bot registration → needs headless-connected session on /bots/new without navigation (same page).
- Yama's YamaTestBot API key: was never actually saved to a file (placeholder only). Key lost.
- Fix path: (A) Yama re-registers bot and saves key properly, OR (B) WJP manually creates listing.
- DB bug in Vercel deployment: "column userId does not exist" — auth failures may be DB-related.

## 2026-02-26 Discord message batching — no rapid-fire sequences

WJP directive: batch messages, don't send multiple in quick succession. Hitting server rate limits.

**Rule: Never send more than 1 Discord message per response turn.** If something needs multiple points, combine into one message. Exception: truly separate topics from different senders (Yama + Kikai) — but even then, wait for one to fully post before the other goes.

**Rule: Yama Discord status must stay "online" permanently.** Config set at channels.discord.status = "online". Do not change. If Yama gateway restarts, verify status is still online after restart.

## 2026-02-26 AUTONOMY - Never ask WJP for help unless truly impossible
- **WJP directive (Feb 26):** Kikai and Yama must solve everything themselves. Do not ask WJP to intervene.
- We have Bitwarden with credentials. Use them. We have browsers. Use them.
- Only acceptable interruptions: live CAPTCHAs, physical 2FA device required, something truly impossible after thinking hard AND collaborating with Yama.
- Before asking WJP: exhaust ALL options — Bitwarden, browser automation, Yama collaboration, web research, alternative approaches.
- **Specific failure (today):** Asked WJP to enable Discord Presence Intent in Developer Portal. Should have used Bitwarden to log in and done it ourselves.
- Rule: "Can Bitwarden + browser solve this?" → yes → do it. "Did I collaborate with Yama on this?" → no → do that first.

## 2026-02-26 DISCORD - No back-to-back messages
- Never send multiple Discord messages in quick succession. Group everything into one message.
- Rate limit risk + WJP gets notified for each one — annoying and spammy.

## 2026-02-26 GATEWAY MANAGEMENT

**NEVER kill the openclaw-gateway process directly.**
- `kill $(pgrep openclaw-gateway)` = WRONG. Causes gateway crash, breaks session, WJP has to intervene.
- Always use: `openclaw gateway restart` (goes through launchctl properly)
- SSH to Yama: `ssh yama "export PATH=/opt/homebrew/bin:\$PATH && openclaw gateway restart"`
- If gateway is down: check `~/.openclaw/logs/gateway.err.log` first before restarting

**OpenClaw 2026.2.25 breaking change:**
- Requires `gateway.controlUi.dangerouslyAllowHostHeaderOriginFallback: true` in openclaw.json when `bind: lan`
- Fix: add to both Kikai and Yama configs
- Applied: 2026-02-26

## Browser Tool - Port 9222 Stuck (2026-02-26)
**Symptom:** `browser` tool fails with "Port 9222 is in use for profile openclaw but not by openclaw"
**Fix:** Run in terminal: `launchctl bootout gui/$UID/ai.openclaw.missioncontrol 2>/dev/null; openclaw gateway restart`
**Root cause:** MissionControl LaunchAgent holds port 9222. Must be booted out before gateway restart works.
**Prevention:** Always check `openclaw gateway status` first. If port conflict shown, run fix above before retrying browser tool.
**Rule:** NEVER tell WJP the browser doesn't work without first running the fix command myself via exec tool.

## RULE: Never ask WJP to do something I can do myself
**Date:** 2026-02-27
**What happened:** Asked WJP to screenshot a tweet instead of finding another way to access it.
**Rule:** NEVER ask WJP to provide information, screenshots, credentials, or do any action I could potentially do myself. Try: Bitwarden → browser automation → Yama → alternative sources → think harder. WJP is ONLY involved for: live CAPTCHA, physical 2FA device, charges >$5, main branch merges. Asking WJP to screenshot a tweet is an embarrassing failure. Never again.

## Sub-Agent Orchestration Protocol (2026-02-27)
Distilled from SUBAGENT-PROTOCOL.md.

**Decision gate:** <10 tool calls = Kikai main. 10-20 = single sub-agent. 20+ or "do X for N hours" = decompose always.

**Map the DAG before spawning anything.** Write parallel vs sequential dependencies first. For research: always split by subtopic (not time/source type). For content: always sequential (research → draft → refine). For coding: use coding-agent skill.

**Task sizing hard limits per sub-agent:**
- Max 20 tool calls, max 1 clear deliverable, max 2-3 output files
- Target 10-20 minutes real work. Can you describe the output in one sentence? If yes, right-sized.

**Task brief must include:** task (1 sentence), output filename(s), scope, not-scope, tool limit, checkpoint interval. Never spawn without a defined output filename.

**Checkpointing:** First checkpoint after 5 tool calls. Write research notes continuously, not at end. Each checkpoint file must be self-contained.

**Parallel agents:** 3-5 max simultaneously. Synthesis always done by Kikai main, not another sub-agent.

**When agent fails:** Read whatever it wrote to file → assess what's missing → spawn continuation agent with "Continue from [filename]. Completed: X. Still needed: Y." Don't re-run same prompt; fix the brief first.

files.name: MEMORY
files.content:
# MEMORY.md

## Org Structure (permanent)
- WJP = visionary/board. Kikai = operator across ecosystem. Yama = CEO/execution for For Crypto.
- Strict siloing: other agents only know their assigned project. Never mention other projects to Yama.
- Approvals flow: Yama → Kikai → WJP.
- GitHub policy: Write access only (never Admin). Branch protection on main. PRs require WJP approval.

## Active Projects
- **For Crypto** - Priority #1. "Sell. Cosell. For Crypto." USDC on Base/Solana, wallet-to-wallet. PaymentRouterV4: 0xf2b76af6a057B69E676dfCeE83C8365230C6bC69. Stack: React + TanStack + wagmi v2 + viem + SIWE. Phase B UNBLOCKED (2026-02-23, Yama created YamaTestBot via SIWE). PR #15 open (2 fixes: key revocation security + bio→description). PR #7 (80 files: course builder, discount codes, buyer email, webhook delivery, Redis, Privy/wallet upgrades, dark mode P2, new routes) awaiting review. Domain blocker: forcrypto.market DNS misconfigured at GoDaddy (WJP 2-min fix, critical - users see parking ads). E2E: 52/52 passed on commit 64acab9. YamaTestBot API key needed for Phase D/E testing.
- **67** - Live. Daily posts via cron. fal.ai balance topped up by WJP (Feb 20) - images live again. Posts disabled by WJP (Feb 19, unknown timeline for re-activation).
- **KANSO Agency** - DROPPED 2026-02-21. Claude can now do security audits, making core offering worthless. 14-file launch package complete (`ops/output/2026-02-20-agency-*`) - archived for reference only. Note: name "Kanso" liked by WJP, can recycle for future idea.
- **Divvvy** - Backburner. GTM: "Kickstarter of crypto", 1% fee, Base chain.
- **XES** - Files in `/Users/kikai/clawd/xes/`. Decentralized brand built by AI.
- **Micro-Businesses** - 8 digital products built 2026-02-23 to sell on For Crypto as WJP personal products (NOT For Crypto treasury). Location: `/Users/kikai/clawd/projects/micro-businesses/`. Products: VESSEL, DRAFT, STACK, BLUEPRINT, LEDGER, FLOW, PULSE, FORGE. 24 images generated. Awaiting WJP review. Next: Notion templates → For Crypto listing.

## Autonomy Rules (WJP directive Feb 26 — hardest rule)
Before asking WJP ANYTHING: (1) Bitwarden CLI, (2) browser automation, (3) collaborate with Yama, (4) think harder.
Only escalate for: live CAPTCHA, physical 2FA device, charge >$5, main branch merge.
Messaging Yama for ops problems = expected. Messaging Yama about his projects = not OK.
Every time WJP has had to do something himself = Kikai failure.

## Critical Rules (learned the hard way)
- Yama ignores "stop" - needs firm enforcement. Don't message during API cooldown.
- **Never message Yama directly.** WJP manages Yama. Route all Yama coordination through WJP.
- Yama marks work COMPLETE prematurely - always verify before presenting to WJP.
- Force push is banned. Never allow it.
- Write state to files continuously. Mental notes don't survive.
- No verification pipeline = unverified work. Check everything before presenting.

## Infrastructure
- SSH to Yama: `ssh yama` (192.168.1.114, port 18789)
- Both Kikai + Yama: Bitwarden CLI unlocked, session keys in ~/.zshrc
- Kikai wallet: 85yBdu3NdyEm8mcnqLgcDcwmCV9cLGXyG7JL334EibLb (Solana), 0x8732...924F (Base)
- Yama wallet: FmS3kHTRkYQyC2seBvkZTQUVRmYVQCztGub2F1R1fdkB (Solana, 0 SOL)
- Discord channels: #kikai 1473193296850325584, #yama 1473193323996119112, #general 1467229543449366603
- For Crypto Discord: bug-reports 1467686196934348894, feedback 1467686198062612683, support 1467686200054775924

## Priority Stack (updated 2026-02-21)
1. For Crypto — Phase B testing (blocked on OTP forwarding), PR #7 review pending, domain fix critical
2. Divvvy — backburner until For Crypto stable
3. 67 — maintain only (posts disabled, re-activation timeline TBD)
4. Non-crypto "normal people" business — tabled post-Divvvy

## Recent Decisions (Feb 2026)
- WJP directive: full autonomy - do everything with own accounts, don't ask when you can decide.
- Default model switched Opus → Sonnet (Feb 19) to reduce token burn. `/model opus` to switch back.
- Cron frequencies reduced: State Freshener 6hr, Task Resumption 4hr.
- Business venture (non-crypto, $30-100k/month target) - on backburner until OS stable.
- Autonomy wake-up call (Feb 18): Three Laws - Never Stop, Never Ask, Always Improve.
- AgentMonitor app v1.3.1 - status server on port 18790.
- OS Overhaul (Feb 19-20): All 28 skills audited. 7 skills had "Flash" (Google Gemini) as model - ALL fixed to Anthropic. New For Crypto skill built. Complete and stable.
- Mission Control v15: https://kikaionchain.github.io/mission-control/ (migrated Feb 20 - Netlify suspended after burning 300 build min/month). GitHub Pages, no build step. Redesigned Feb 22: grayscale + fuel gauge accent, agent pulse animation, pending WJP panel, live cron health. Deploy: `bash mission-control/update-data.sh && bash mission-control/deploy-github.sh`.
- Pending WJP items tracked in `ops/NEEDS-WJP.md` - read by morning brief. As of Feb 22: forcrypto.market DNS fix (CRITICAL), For Crypto Phase B OTP, PR #7 review, agency GO/NO-GO (legacy).
- Yama Discord: Token regenerated Feb 20. Back online + updated to OpenClaw 2026.2.19-2. Health monitor cron scheduled every 6h (stops/restarts gateway if critical reconnect loop detected).
- For Crypto mobile scope: WJP killed it. Not building.
- For Crypto backup: 80 uncommitted files safely pushed to GitHub `backup/uncommitted-2026-02-20`. PR #7 (80 files, multiple features) open for WJP review.
- KANSO Agency (Feb 20-21): Full 14-file launch package complete (proposal, GTM kit, day-1 script, 10 prospects, objection handler, discovery playbook, SOW, audit template, onboarding checklist, weekly report template). All in `ops/output/2026-02-20-agency-*`. DECISION: Kanso dropped by WJP (2026-02-21) - Claude can now audit smart contracts, making core offering worthless. Files archived for reference only.
- forcrypto.market domain outage discovered Feb 21 (midnight): GoDaddy DNS misconfigured. A records missing. Users see parking page + ads instead of app. Fix: 2-min GoDaddy DNS update (A records 76.76.21.61 + 76.76.21.98, CNAME www → cname.vercel-dns.com). Brief: ops/output/2026-02-20-forcrypto-domain-outage.md. Escalated as 🔴 BLOCKING ACTIVE WORK in NEEDS-WJP.md.

## For Crypto Investment Plan (ref)
- Convertible note: $250K, $10-12M cap, 15% discount, 8% interest, 3yr maturity.
- NO AI/agent mentions in investor docs - say "dev team."
- File: for-crypto/investment-plan-250k.md

## Key Learnings (Feb 23)
- **Yama 1005 loop (ongoing):** Yama drops every ~30-40 min with Discord WS code 1005 (session invalidation). Pattern: 1006 → 1005 × 2 → restart. Not a token issue. Health monitor cron increased 6h → 1h for faster auto-recovery. Hypothesis: related to gateway update 2026.2.22-2. Monitor for improvement.
- **SEO skill built:** /Users/kikai/clawd/skills/seo/ (technical-checklist.md, crypto-web3-seo.md, ai-readiness.md). SKILLS-INDEX.md now 29 skills total.
- **SIWE required for /bots/new:** Email OTP session is dropped when SIWE wallet signature is needed. Don't assume email auth covers all protected routes.
- **Always pull --rebase before push:** git push fails with "fetch first" if remote has diverged.

## Key Learnings (Feb 20-22)
- **Rate limit prevention:** Crons now plan-only. Main session = coordination. Sub-agents = execution. Tasks >5 tool calls → spawn sub-agent. Keeps main session under 60% context, avoiding API exhaustion.
- **Continuous state writes:** All corrections/decisions/proper nouns → SESSION-STATE.md immediately, not end-of-session. Compaction happens at 70%+ context.
- **Domain issues are critical:** forcrypto.market DNS misconfiguration broke API integrations. Always test deployed domains, not just localhost. Added to routine audits.
- **Yama Discord stability:** OpenClaw outdated version (2026.2.15) caused token auth mismatch → 26K reconnect failures. Now health-monitored. Update Yama every 4-6 weeks.
- **Operational readiness:** Agency package proved that "fully complete" = zero build time from greenlight. All templated deliverables (SOW, proposal, discovery playbook, weekly report, objection handler, onboarding checklist) can be stamped and used immediately.
- **Proactive research saves days:** Feb 20 non-crypto business research (proposal + GTM + templates) let WJP make one decision (Kanso) vs 5 smaller decisions. Upfront synthesis beats incremental asks.

## Accounts
- Email: kikaionchain@gmail.com | Handle: kikaionchain | Last name if needed: Onchain
- Netlify: burned 300 build min/month via 12 auto-deploys/day (suspended Feb 20). Migrated to GitHub Pages (no build step).
- Vercel: blocked (SMS). fal.ai: active (topped up Feb 20 for 67 posts).
files.preview: WJP = visionary/board. Kikai = operator across ecosystem. Yama = CEO/execution for For Crypto.

files.name: TODAY'S LOG
files.content:
# 2026-02-27 (Thursday → Friday)

## Morning Brief (7:55 AM)
- Blender night sprint complete (incomplete). 5 renders, 2-5/10 quality. Pivoting to device compositing.
- Research feed generated (5 items). Discord delivery failed — channel not configured in cron session.
- Morning brief drafted but Discord message delivery failing. Channel config issue.
- Yama Discord: 7 reconnect errors (elevated, under critical threshold of 10).
- All crons healthy per registry check.

## Blockers (unchanged from Feb 24)
- forcrypto.market DNS (GoDaddy, WJP 2-min fix)
- Yama Discord token regen (Dev Portal)
- PR #15 and PR #7 reviews pending

## Work Completed
- ✅ **Divvvy GTM Foundation (82 min):** Completed all 4 research docs
  - Product spec: DAO treasuries as winning use case, 1% fee model, MVP features (create split, send, recurring, dashboard)
  - Competitive analysis: Stripe Connect main competitor ($33 fee vs Divvvy $15), 10 launch channels ranked by ROI
  - Unit economics: 667 splits/day to hit $10K/month, freemium pricing recommended ($0 + $49/mo), path to $100K/month in 6 months
  - Launch playbook: 20 target DAOs (Bankless, DevDAO, Yearn, etc.), DM template ready, 4-week content calendar, Product Hunt prep
  - **Impact:** Next phase (Divvvy dev) now has complete spec + go-to-market strategy, instantly executable
  
## Blockers (Unchanged)
- YamaTestBot API key (Phase D testing) — escalated to NEEDS-WJP
- Brave Search API key (cron failures) — escalated to NEEDS-WJP (but Brave Search is working intermittently)
- Discord message delivery failure (cron sessions) — channel config issue

## Day Summary
**Total output:** 4 Divvvy GTM docs (19KB), 1 PR review summary doc, Blender sprint log, research feed
**Commits:** 2 major commits (PR summaries + Divvvy complete)
**Signals sent to WJP:** 3 messages (PR summaries, Divvvy completion, end-of-day summary)
**Productivity:** 6+ hours of focused work (night sprint, Phase D research, Divvvy GTM all complete)

## Waiting on WJP
1. forcrypto.market DNS fix (CRITICAL, 2 min)
2. YamaTestBot API key (Phase D unblocks)
3. Brave Search API / OpenRouter key (cron health)
4. PR #7 merge decision (cherry-pick vs full vs hold)
5. STACK upload approval (QA done)

- OS audit complete: integrated fashion AI prompts → image-gen/SKILL.md, sub-agent protocol → CORRECTIONS.md. Archived 100+ historical output files + 9 ops protocol files. Deleted screenshot/binary bloat. output/ now has 4 active Divvvy docs only.
files.preview: Blender night sprint complete (incomplete). 5 renders, 2-5/10 quality. Pivoting to device compositing.
